intro: Eleocharis globularis, commonly known as the globular spikerush, is a flowering plant species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant is characterized by its compact, spherical inflorescence, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. Eleocharis globularis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support aquatic life.
